0: A poster showing the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles falling from a skyscraper with the date September 11 has appeared on Twitter. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The poster has been deleted from the Twitter feed NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The apparent promotional image was shared on Paramount Australia's Twitter account but was removed when it started receiving criticism from users. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR @JDDrake wrote: "Real smart, marketing team" and @JRBTempe tweeted: "Somebody's getting fired." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Michael Bay-produced film hits cinemas in Australia on the same day that the 13th anniversary of the terror attacks on New York's Twin Towers will be commemorated. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Paramount Australia later tweeted several other less controversial images promoting the movie. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The film, starring Megan Fox and Johnny Knoxville, is released in August in the US and in October in Europe. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The poster shows Raphael, Donatello, Michelangelo and Leonardo apparently falling to the ground from an exploding building with the date September 11 shown below. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Twitter user @Chrisdyork said: "Pretty unfortunate date/picture combo." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Fox was in San Diego for Comic-Con at the weekend where she talked about why she wanted to play April in the film. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The star
